channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023080633
item.description:
Report X-2023080633

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING ALLOWING MOVEMENT THIS ALLOWED CAP TO BECOME CRACKED AND LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR. BOX WAS UNDECLARED NO DIAMOND LABELS, UP ARROWS, HAZMAT SERVICE CODE OR ANY HAZMAT DOCUMENTATION. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX AND PRODUCT WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

  • City: GROVE CITY

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, a few of the press and twist caps were loose allowing liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking.

item.title: Report E-2023070962
item.description:
Report E-2023070962

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to failure of the container cap from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jug. Enviroserve personnel removed all freight from the pallet to verify that one jug was impacted. Enviroserve personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted trailer floor. The spent material was recovered and containerized into one 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The non-damaged freight was restacked onto a pallet and shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070936
item.description:
Report E-2023070936

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured by a nail and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor and wood pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews applied a patch to the damaged 5-gallon pail to contain the remaining product for disposal purposes. The impacted pallet was dismantled with a sawzall for disposal. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove any residual product from the impacted surfaces. The dismantled pallet and all UN3264-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal. The one (1) damaged pail was collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023070466
item.description:
Report X-2023070466

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: WOOSTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THIS PACKAGE HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY RETURNED BECAUSE IT HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY AND ORM-D MARKING APPLIED TO AN AIR PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS RESHIPPED WITHOUT THE LTD QTY OR ORM-D. RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED TO INSPECT CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 14 X 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE AGCO PARTS MACHINERY ENAMEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: One of the press and twist caps was loose and at an angle allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking

item.title: Report E-2023070793
item.description:
Report E-2023070793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: GALLIPOLIS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 7, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of acetone were dropped due to mishandling and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. TLE noted that the material had hardened to the dock floor. The crew utilized acetone and hand tools to removed the product from the dock floor. All damaged pails, impacted absorbents, and product were contained in two (2) 35-gallon drums of waste. Following approval from the onsite contact, TLE secured the waste for delivery to the R+L terminal in Wilmington.
